ARCH 118.courseDesc: Introduces basic architectural design principles. Elementary concepts of space, surface and form will be explored through investigation of abstract and applied design projects explored in two and three- dimensional abstract exercises. Exercises incorporate heightened observational analysis and graphic skills.
ARCH 118.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 119.courseDesc: Investigates basic architectural design principles that emphasize the inter-relationship between the scale of the human body and its movement within three-dimensional space. Design exercises will advance the understanding of the design process, development of a conceptual idea and a higher-level graphic and oral presentation.
ARCH 119.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 119.prereqs: ARCH 118 [Min Grade C] or ARCH 191 [Min Grade C]

ARCH 140.courseDesc: Historical survey of architecture from prehistory through today drawn from around the globe (and from Philadelphia) that considers broadly applicable topics including style, material, construction, and function. Intended for non-majors as an introduction to architecture and urbanism.
ARCH 140.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 141.courseDesc: This survey course examines the evolution of architectural and urban thought, form, space, and structure in light of changing human values and institutions. Particular attention is paid to materials, meaning, and use. It explores global built environments from the prehistoric era through the early Medieval period (9th century CE) in Europe, the Americas, Asia, and Africa.
ARCH 141.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 142.courseDesc: This survey course examines the evolution of architectural and urban thought and form in light of changing human values and institutions, with particular attention paid to materials, technology, meaning, and use. It explores global built environments from the early Medieval period (9th century CE) through the 18th century in Europe, the Americas, Asia, and Africa.
ARCH 142.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 143.courseDesc: This survey course examines the evolution of architectural and urban thought and form in light of changing human values and institutions, with particular attention paid to materials, technology, meaning, and use. It explores global modern built environments from the 18th century through the 21st century in Europe, the Americas, Asia, Australasia, and Africa.
ARCH 143.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 170.courseDesc: Introduction to the fundamental aspects of building technology with exposure to materials, structure and building systems that are frequently used in building construction. Provides a framework for the exploration of construction in the context of design.
ARCH 170.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 170.prereqs: PHYS 182 [Min Grade C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 172.courseDesc: Further exploration of materials, structure and building systems and their influence on passive systems and sustainable design principles. Begins the development of systematic thinking regarding architectural technology.
ARCH 172.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 173.courseDesc: Introduction to the technical building analysis including the organizing principles for materials, structure and systems. Includes envelope assembly, thermal comfort, structural and passive building systems.
ARCH 173.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 181.courseDesc: Introduces basic architectural design principles. Elementary concepts of space, surface and form will be explored in two and three dimensional abstract exercises. Exercises incorporate observational analysis and graphic skills.
ARCH 181.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 182.courseDesc: Transitions from abstract design principles to simple architectural exercises, considering function, scale, user and ordering strategies in relation to form-making in three-dimensional space. Exercises heighten observation and graphic skills while developing an architectural vocabulary.
ARCH 182.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 183.courseDesc: Focuses on a series of basic architectural problems developed around issues of context and material use in relationship to the organization of space and human activity. Design exercises will cultivate the design process through developing a conceptual idea through graphic and oral communication.
ARCH 183.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 183.prereqs: ARCH 182 [Min Grade C] or INTR 233 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 191.courseDesc: Architectural engineering majors only. Covers basic design principles using three-dimensional abstract and applied projects. Exercises heighten observation skills.
ARCH 191.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 192.courseDesc: Architectural engineering majors only. ContinuesARCH 191. Uses design exercises to emphasize the nature of function, structure, and material and their impact on the design process.
ARCH 192.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 211.courseDesc: Introductory course that will provide a survey of drawing types with an emphasis on process and visual literacy.
ARCH 211.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 212.courseDesc: Emphasis on craft and composition in the architectural representation of the built environment.
ARCH 212.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 213.courseDesc: Exploration of digital representation with an emphasis on making combining process drawing, digital fabrication and analog craft to develop three-dimensional representation skills.
ARCH 213.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 221.courseDesc: Introduction to the fundamental aspects of building technology with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Provides a framework for the exploration of construction in the context of design.
ARCH 221.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 222.courseDesc: Further exploration of materials, structure and building systems and their influence on passive systems and sustainable design principles. Begins the development of systematic thinking regarding architectural technology.
ARCH 222.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 223.courseDesc: Introduction to technical building analysis including the organizing principles for materials, structure and systems. Includes envelope assembly, thermal comfort, structural and passive building systems.
ARCH 223.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 224.courseDesc: Emphasizes the communication of design through perspective, view-making and rendering. Through the use of digital and analog techniques, the ability to select the proper media to visually convey a design concept will be developed.
ARCH 224.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 224.prereqs: ARCH 213 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 183 [Min Grade C]

ARCH 225.courseDesc: Emphasizes the tools to complete a final quality architectural presentation in a variety of venues including portfolios, digital representations and online media.
ARCH 225.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 225.prereqs: ARCH 224 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 281 [Min Grade C]

ARCH 226.courseDesc: Explores parametric thinking and the iterative design process while reinforcing critical skills in detailing and design development through various software programs.
ARCH 226.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 226.prereqs: ARCH 225 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 282 [Min Grade C]

ARCH 251.courseDesc: Introduction to the fundamental aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
ARCH 251.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 251.prereqs: ARCH 183 [Min Grade C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 252.courseDesc: Further introduction to the fundamental aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
ARCH 252.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 253.courseDesc: Introduction and intermediate aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
ARCH 253.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 274.courseDesc: Intermediate development of architectural technology with a focus on application of analysis of primary materials, structure and systems. Depth and range of analytical tools are addressed.
ARCH 274.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 274.prereqs: ARCH 173 [Min Grade C-] and PHYS 183 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 275.courseDesc: Further development of analytical skills for building technology. Case studies and real world precedents examine materials, structure and systems in the support of larger architectural objectives.
ARCH 275.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 276.courseDesc: Examination of technical analysis and design in support of iterative architectural concepts. Materials, structure and systems are utilized to develop strong design synergies.
ARCH 276.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 281.courseDesc: Introduces issues of architectural form, site and programmatic concerns. Design exercises will explore simple issues of structure, building and material systems and sustainability.
ARCH 281.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 281.prereqs: ARCH 183 [Min Grade C] and (ARCH 213 [Min Grade C] or INTR 245 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 282.courseDesc: Covers architectural design problems of incremental complexity that emphasizes the nature of function, structure, and material and their impact on the design process.
ARCH 282.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 282.prereqs: ((ARCH 221 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 251 [Min Grade C-]) or ARCH 170 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 351 [Min Grade C-], ) and ARCH 281 [Min Grade C] and (ARCH 224 [Min Grade C] or INTR 341 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 283.courseDesc: Explores architectural design problems that introduce the full range of challenges in the areas of organization, program, context, systems and formal expression.
ARCH 283.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 283.prereqs: ((ARCH 222 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 252 [Min Grade C-]) or ARCH 170 [Min Grade C-]) and ARCH 282 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 225 [Min Grade C]

ARCH 291.courseDesc: Introduction to architectural technology with a focus on application of analysis pertaining to environmental systems within the context of building design.
ARCH 291.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 291.prereqs: ARCH 283 [Min Grade C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 292.courseDesc: Introduction to architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to water within the context of building design.
ARCH 292.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 292.prereqs: ARCH 283 [Min Grade C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 293.courseDesc: Introduction to architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to lighting within the context of building design.
ARCH 293.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 293.prereqs: ARCH 283 [Min Grade C-] and PHYS 182 [Min Grade C-] and (MATH 102 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 173 [Min Grade C-] or MATH 183 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 315.courseDesc: Provides an overview of contemporary sustainable design principles and systems involved to posit novel solutions to various design challenges. Combining theoretical knowledge, field trips and case studies enabling students to critically assess sustainability as it relates to the built environment through five key subsystems: materials, air, water, energy and life.
ARCH 315.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 320.courseDesc: Students will examine the work of scientists, designers, authors, artists, architects, engineers, planners, etc to gain a deeper conceptual understanding of current and emerging strategies in sustainability and the complex and integrated systems approach to the built environment in the present and near future.
ARCH 320.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 324.courseDesc: Advanced building technology concepts are explored through case studies and focused design examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
ARCH 324.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 324.prereqs: ARCH 173 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 223 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 325.courseDesc: Further exploration of advanced building technology concepts through case studies and focused design examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
ARCH 325.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 326.courseDesc: Advanced integration of building technology concepts through design problems and examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
ARCH 326.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 335.courseDesc: This seminar is the first of a two-course sequence that introduces students to varying topics related to architectural practice in today's society. It addresses the following issues: Community and Social Responsibility, Leadership, Ethics & Professional Judgment, Client Role in Architecture, Basic Principles of Architectural Practice.
ARCH 335.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 335.prereqs: ARCH 243 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 383 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 336.courseDesc: This seminar is the second of a two-course sequence that introduces students to varying topics related to architectural practice in today’s society. It addresses the following issues: Practice Management, Project Management, Financial Considerations, Legal Responsibilities, Ethics & Professional Judgment.
ARCH 336.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 340.courseDesc: Surveys the development of American architecture and urbanism from its Native American origins through the arrival of early Modernism in the 1930s and 1940s.
ARCH 340.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 340.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 341.courseDesc: Seminar that examines theories and principles of Western architecture before 1700. History/theory elective.
ARCH 341.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 341.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 342.courseDesc: ContinuesARCH 341. Seminar that examines theories and principles of Western architecture from the Baroque era of the 17th century to the beginning of Modernism in the 20th century. History/theory elective.
ARCH 342.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 342.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 343.courseDesc: Seminar that examines 20th-century theories of architecture, including analysis and discussion of current theoretical positions. History/theory elective. Spring.
ARCH 343.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 343.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 346.courseDesc: Covers the architecture of the city of Philadelphia from 1682, examining its architects, styles, and sources through lectures, walking tours, and student reports. History/theory elective. Fall. Alternate years.
ARCH 346.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 346.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 347.courseDesc: An intensive study tour of selected domestic and foreign destinations focusing on architecture and related design disciplines. Combines lecture, site visits, sketching and individual research. History/Theory Elective.
ARCH 347.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 347.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
ARCH 347.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 200 [Min Grade C-] or ARTH 103 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 348.courseDesc: A topical survey of world traditions of vernacular architecture, with emphasis on houses and dwelling environments. The survey topics include basics of shelter, construction methods, response to climate, patterns of settlement, social and economic organization, cultural expression, and methods of research and analysis.
ARCH 348.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 348.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 350.courseDesc: Survey and analysis of significant developments in architecture and urbanism over the past 50+ years.
ARCH 350.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 350.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 354.courseDesc: Intermediate aspects of structural systems with exposure to materials and methods that are frequently used in building construction. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
ARCH 354.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 354.prereqs: ARCH 173 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 253 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 355.courseDesc: Intermediate structural analysis for architectural design. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
ARCH 355.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 356.courseDesc: Intermediate structural analysis for architectural design with a focus on composite systems. Develops skills needed for structural integration in building design.
ARCH 356.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 377.courseDesc: Advanced building technology concepts are explored through case studies and focused design examples. Materials, construction, methods, structure, systems and envelope are studied as integrated aspect of larger iterative design processes.
ARCH 377.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 378.courseDesc: Building technology and analysis are explored through design precedents and sketch problems to develop integrated design and analytical skills. Focuses on large and small scale elements that can become generative and performative aspects of major design decisions.
ARCH 378.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 379.courseDesc: Advanced building technology design and analysis is utilized in iterative and integrated design methods to support comprehensive design processes. Materials, structure and systems are developed qualitatively and quantitatively through design and analysis exercises.
ARCH 379.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 381.courseDesc: Investigates the design relationship between man-made and the natural environment. Cultivates advanced analysis methods and the development of informed and resolved design solutions.
ARCH 381.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 381.prereqs: ARCH 283 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 226 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 223 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 253 [Min Grade C]

ARCH 382.courseDesc: Studies the relationship between building, site and context. Architectural design problems emphasize concept development that translates careful analysis into the building ideas with a progressing understanding of architectural concerns.
ARCH 382.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 382.prereqs: ARCH 381 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 274 [Min Grade C-] or (ARCH 291 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 354 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 383.courseDesc: Focuses on architectural problems with intermediate complexity. Integrates issues of context, site, program, function, and architectural systems into advanced design proposals.
ARCH 383.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 383.prereqs: ARCH 382 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 275 [Min Grade C-] or (ARCH 292 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 355 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 394.courseDesc: Intermediate study of architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to mechanical systems within the context of building design.
ARCH 394.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 395.courseDesc: Intermediate study of architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to acoustical design and energy consumption within the context of building design.
ARCH 395.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 396.courseDesc: Intermediate study of architectural technology with a focus on design impacts and analysis related to lighting and electrical systems within the context of building design.
ARCH 396.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 421.courseDesc: Examines the relationship between human behavior and architecture from the perspective of environmental psychology. Topics include aesthetics, environmental experience, social interaction, social organization, and culture. History/Theory Elective.
ARCH 421.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 421.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 431.courseDesc: Introduces current techniques of building programming and their relationship to building design.
ARCH 431.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 431.prereqs: ARCH 353 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 483 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 432.courseDesc: Introduces the process of land development. Explores traditional and emerging development models (the architect as the equity participant and developer) in relation to new construction and rehabilitation. Covers various methods of initiating building projects and financing and tax issues. Professional elective. Spring.
ARCH 432.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 441.courseDesc: Expands the concept of architecture to urban design scale and presents the principles of city planning through a series of case studies. History/Theory Elective.
ARCH 441.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 441.prereqs: ARCH 143 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 144 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 451.courseDesc: Covers advanced architectural rendering, concentrating on the effects of light, shade, and color using the techniques of water-color rendering. Professional elective. Spring.
ARCH 451.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 451.prereqs: ARCH 226 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 341 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 455.courseDesc: Covers two-dimensional and three-dimensional computer representations and applications. Professional elective.
ARCH 455.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 463.courseDesc: A holistic study of design and construction technology of significant buildings by leading architects through case studies. This course offers a unique opportunity to engage the topic of meaning in architecture through the lenses of spatial understanding and methods of technology and construction.
ARCH 463.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 463.prereqs: ARCH 253 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 451 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 464.courseDesc: Examines the integrations of aesthetics, building science, and technology in the design of building enclosures. Professional Elective. Summer.
ARCH 464.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 465.courseDesc: Creates an awareness of the availability of energy resources and their effect on the built environment. Discusses alternative sources of energy. Professional elective.
ARCH 465.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 466.courseDesc: This seminar will explore architectural detail as a key to understanding of the craft and intrinsic nature of time, technology and cultural importance of the building.
ARCH 466.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 466.prereqs: ARCH 326 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 350 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 674 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 467.courseDesc: An introduction to historic preservation as it relates to the built environment. The goal of this course is to familiarize the student with the history and the legal, theoretical and policy underpinnings of the historic preservation movement.
ARCH 467.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 467.prereqs: (ARCH 143 [Min Grade C] or INTR 200 [Min Grade C]) and (ARCH 283 [Min Grade C] or INTR 342 [Min Grade C] or INTR 442 [Min Grade C])

ARCH 481.courseDesc: Focuses on more complex architectural challenges through analysis of case studies that address the relationship between the man-made built environment and the natural environment.
ARCH 481.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 481.prereqs: ARCH 383 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 276 [Min Grade C-] or (ARCH 356 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 293 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 482.courseDesc: Furthers the understanding of context and design and the application of solutions and strategies surrounding more complex architectural and environmental problems.
ARCH 482.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 482.prereqs: ARCH 481 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 377 [Min Grade C-] or (ARCH 324 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 394 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 483.courseDesc: Challenges to develop and refine architectural solutions through an advanced understanding of the relationship between buildings and environment.
ARCH 483.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 483.prereqs: ARCH 482 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 378 [Min Grade C-] or (ARCH 325 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 395 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 484.courseDesc: This design studio is taught as a vertical studio combining students from multiple years. Sections of this studio focus on a variety of special issues in the broader realm of architecture, urbanism and design and may be taught as an interdisciplinary studio.
ARCH 484.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 484.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 12 credits
ARCH 484.prereqs: (ARCH 382 [Min Grade C] or INTR 342 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 442 [Min Grade C-]) and ARCH 482 [Min Grade C]

ARCH 487.courseDesc: Addresses the complex relationship through analysis and synthesis of form, site, program, building technology and theory within specific building context.
ARCH 487.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 487.prereqs: ARCH 483 [Min Grade C] and ARCH 379 [Min Grade C-] or (ARCH 326 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 356 [Min Grade C-] and ARCH 396 [Min Grade C-])

ARCH 488.courseDesc: Emphasizes complex architectural problems while demonstrating understanding and appropriate application.
ARCH 488.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 489.courseDesc: Integrates in-depth application and coordination of all architectural building criteria in a large scale and complex architectural problem.
ARCH 489.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 490.courseDesc: This course is the first part of a two-term capstone project consistent with the student’s curricular concentration, and relevant to their professional and academic goals. This course is devoted to an introduction to methods applicable to architectural design and research that will lead to the capstone project in the second term.
ARCH 490.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 490.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 8 credits

ARCH 492.courseDesc: This course is the second part of a two-term capstone project consistent with the student’s curricular concentration, and relevant to their professional and academic goals. This course is devoted to the continued research in architectural theory, technology and/or design and the completion and presentation of a capstone project.
ARCH 492.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 492.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 8 credits

ARCH 493.courseDesc: Students develop a three-term capstone design project to pursue and explore architectural concepts in depth. Students take a project from concept, research, programming to complete design development. Part one of three.
ARCH 493.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH 493.prereqs: (ARCH 363 [Min Grade C-] or ARCH 489 [Min Grade C]) and ARCH 431 [Min Grade C-]

ARCH 494.courseDesc: Students develop a three-term capstone design project to pursue and explore architectural concepts in depth. Students take a project from concept, research, programming to complete design development. Part two of three.
ARCH 494.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH 495.courseDesc: Students develop a three-term capstone design project to pursue and explore architectural concepts in depth. Students take a project from concept, research, programming to complete design development. Part three of three.
ARCH 495.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

ARCH I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
ARCH I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

ARCH I299.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
ARCH I299.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH I299.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

ARCH I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
ARCH I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

ARCH I499.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
ARCH I499.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH I499.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

ARCH T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
ARCH T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

ARCH T280.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
ARCH T280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH T280.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

ARCH T380.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
ARCH T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

ARCH T480.courseDesc: Covers special topics in architectural history, theory, or technology that satisfy history/theory or professional elective requirements.
ARCH T480.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
ARCH T480.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
